docs.name: Bhutan: Number of water insufficiencies in a typical month
docs.description:
Number of water shortages in a typical month.   Source:World Bank, Enterprise Surveys Project(http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/Data/ExploreTopics/infrastructure).
Number of water insufficiencies in a typical month

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Net trade in goods (BoP, current US$)
docs.description:
Net trade in goods is the difference between exports and imports of goods. Trade in services is not included. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
Net trade in goods (BoP, current US$)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Net capital account (BoP, current US$)
docs.description:
Net capital account records acquisitions and disposals of nonproduced nonfinancial assets, such as land sold to embassies and sales of leases and licenses, as well as capital transfers, including government debt forgiveness. The use of the term capital account in this context is designed to be consistent with the System of National Accounts, which distinguishes between capital transactions and financial transactions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
Net capital account (BoP, current US$)

docs.name: Bhutan: Notice period for redundancy dismissal (for a worker with 20 years of tenure, in salary weeks)
docs.description:
Notice period for redundancy dismissal (for a worker with 20 years of tenure, in salary weeks)
Notice period for redundancy dismissal (for a worker with 20 years of tenure, in salary weeks)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Government Effectiveness: Standard Error
docs.description:
Government Effectiveness captures perceptions of the quality of public services, the quality of the civil service and the degree of its independence from political pressures, the quality of policy formulation and implementation, and the credibility of the government's commitment to such policies.
Government Effectiveness: Standard Error

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary.  Female
docs.description:
Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Female is the total number of females enrolled in tertiary social sciences, business and law programs.
Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary.  Female

docs.name: Bhutan: Percent of firms identifying corruption as a major constraint
docs.description:
Percent of firms identifying corruption as a major constraint. The computation of the indicator is based on the rating of the obstacle as a potential constraint to the current operations of the establishment.   Source:World Bank, Enterprise Surveys Project(http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/Data/ExploreTopics/corruption).
Percent of firms identifying corruption as a major constraint

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Arable land (% of land area)
docs.description:
Arable land includes land defined by the FAO as land under temporary crops (double-cropped areas are counted once), temporary meadows for mowing or for pasture, land under market or kitchen gardens, and land temporarily fallow. Land abandoned as a result of shifting cultivation is excluded.
Arable land (% of land area)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Population, aged 7-11, female
docs.description:
Population, age 7-11, female is the total number of females age 7-11.
Population, aged 7-11, female

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Tariff rate, most favored nation, simple mean, manufactured products (%)
docs.description:
Simple mean most favored nation tariff rate is the unweighted average of most favored nation rates for all products subject to tariffs calculated for all traded goods. Data are classified using the Harmonized System of trade at the six- or eight-digit level. Tariff line data were matched to Standard International Trade Classification (SITC) revision 3 codes to define commodity groups. Manufactured products are commodities classified in SITC revision 3 sections 5-8 excluding division 68.
Tariff rate, most favored nation, simple mean, manufactured products (%)

docs.name: Bhutan: PPG, IDA (NTR, current US$)
docs.description:
Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Net transfers are net flows minus interest payments during the year; negative transfers show net transfers made by the borrower to the creditor during the year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
PPG, IDA (NTR, current US$)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Discrepancy in expenditure estimate of GDP (constant LCU)
docs.description:
A statistical discrepancy usually arises when the GDP components are estimated independently by industrial origin and by expenditure categories. This item represents the discrepancy in the use of resources (i.e., the estimate of GDP by expenditure categories). Data are in constant local currency.
Discrepancy in expenditure estimate of GDP (constant LCU)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: percentage of population (15+), 45-49, total, incomplete primary
docs.description:
Percentage of population, 45-49, total, incomplete primary is the percentage of the population age 45-49 who did not complete primary education.
percentage of population (15+), 45-49, total, incomplete primary

docs.name: Bhutan: Trained teachers in primary education (% of total teachers)
docs.description:
Percentage of trained teachers. Primary. Total is the number of teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers at the primary level.
Trained teachers in primary education (% of total teachers)

docs.name: Barbados: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio.  Lower secondary.  All programmes
docs.description:
Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Lower secondary. All programmes is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary (All programmes) to the male gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary (All programmes). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females. 
Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio.  Lower secondary.  All programmes

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Agricultural raw materials imports (% of merchandise imports)
docs.description:
Agricultural raw materials comprise SITC section 2 (crude materials except fuels) excluding divisions 22, 27 (crude fertilizers and minerals excluding coal, petroleum, and precious stones), and 28 (metalliferous ores and scrap).
Agricultural raw materials imports (% of merchandise imports)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Exports of goods and services (BoP, current US$)
docs.description:
Exports of goods and services comprise all transactions between residents of a country and the rest of the world involving a change of ownership from residents to nonresidents of general merchandise, net exports of goods under merchanting, nonmonetary gold, and services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
Exports of goods and services (BoP, current US$)

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Population, aged 17, female
docs.description:
Population, age 17, female refers to the female population at the specified age.
Population, aged 17, female

docs.name: Brunei Darussalam: Life expectancy at birth, female (years)
docs.description:
Life expectancy at birth indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.
Life expectancy at birth, female (years)

docs.name: Barbados: Population, aged 7-11, female
docs.description:
Population, age 7-11, female is the total number of females age 7-11.
Population, aged 7-11, female

sources.description: Data on economic development, poverty, health and society, for every country in the world.  Monthly commodity price data.
sources.name: World Bank
